name: Islamic Relief USA
mission:
Islamic Relief USA provides relief and development in a dignified manner regardless of gender, race, or religion, and works to empower individuals in their communities and give them a voice in the world.

Incorporated in 1993 in California, Islamic Relief USA has provided humanitarian support in the United States and internationally for nearly 30 years.
theoryOfChange: States that contributions provide immediate relief (food, water, medical aid, shelter) and also support long-term solutions such as community development, water wells, skills training, women launching small businesses, and helping children return to school, with the goal of creating a world free of poverty.

evaluationSources: BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://irusa.org/zakat (Source: https://irusa.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 44/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; good program ratio (≥75%) suggests reasonable delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Relief USA shows exceptional alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://irusa.org/zakat (Source: https://irusa.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Islamic Relief USA holds a 100.0/100 score and a program expense ratio of 80.3%.
The charity is Zakat-eligible and follows specific policies for asnaf categories.
The organization reported a total revenue of $165,235,589.
Islamic Relief USA serves people via Bahri Hospital and supports displaced families in Sudan.
Programs include Palestinian medical sector fortification and hospital rehabilitation.
The organization provides various donation options and giving methods for donors.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial accountability, Zakat-eligible status, and high alignment with humanitarian cause urgency.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing direct impact measurement transparency to reach the highest scoring tier
Expanding public documentation for specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics across all programs

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a Zakat-eligible entity with a dedicated Zakat catalog and policy [2][6]. Its focus on urgent humanitarian needs, including COVID-19 response and support for forcibly displaced families, reflects a strong track record in addressing high-priority global crises [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: Islamic Relief USA demonstrates strong program effectiveness through direct services, such as rehabilitating the Bahri Hospital and fortifying the Palestinian medical sector [4][5]. With a total revenue of $165,235,589 and a program expense ratio of 80.3%, the organization directs the vast majority of its resources toward humanitarian aid and vulnerable families [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Islamic Relief USA provides comprehensive humanitarian aid and poverty alleviation programs both domestically and internationally.
strengths: Maintains a perfect Charity Navigator score of 100.0/100
High financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 80.3%
Strong liquidity with 18.0 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: Islamic Relief USA is a non-profit organization dedicated to creating a world free of poverty through emergency response and long-term development [1][4]. The organization is Zakat-eligible, maintaining a specific policy to ensure donations reach designated asnaf categories [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial accountability, Zakat-eligible status, and high alignment with humanitarian cause urgency.

areas_for_improvement.context: While program ratios are high, the charity currently <cite id="15">lacks public cost-per-beneficiary metrics</cite> for many individual programs, which would help donors assess comparative effectiveness.
With <cite id="8">18.0 months of working capital</cite>, the charity could improve transparency by publishing specific triggers for the deployment of these high reserves.

bbb_assessment.summary: The charity is currently <cite id="16">under review by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance</cite>.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization tracks high-level outcomes and maintains a Platinum transparency rating to mitigate data gaps.
risk_factors: <cite id="15">Absence of standardized outcome tracking</cite> for all program sites
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is a lack of granular impact data: <cite id="15">no specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics</cite> are currently available for external evaluation.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data from 2023; Program data from 2025 catalog
confidence.notes: Strong alignment between financial filings and programmatic claims.

alignment.explanation: IRUSA is a premier fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="9">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and serving <cite id="2">vulnerable populations in Muslim-majority crisis zones</cite>.
alignment.improvement: The charity could further improve alignment by <cite id="17">expanding services to underserved geographies</cite> where nonprofit coverage remains limited.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust IRUSA due to its <cite id="10">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>, <cite id="13">100% independent board</cite>, and three decades of <cite id="1">operating history since 1994</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, the organization could work toward <cite id="16">meeting all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards</cite>, as current reviews show pending evaluations.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with an <cite id="7">80.3% program expense ratio</cite> and direct service delivery in <cite id="4">high-need regions like Gaza and Sudan</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="15">publishing consistent beneficiary counts</cite> across all sectors to allow for standardized cost-effectiveness analysis.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Strong outcome tracking but limited cost-effectiveness data

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Funds local partners to ensure culturally competent and rapid delivery of aid.
top_recipients: Local implementing partners in crisis zones

rich_narrative.headline: Islamic Relief USA provides comprehensive humanitarian aid and poverty alleviation programs both domestically and internationally.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill zakat through a large-scale, highly transparent institution with a proven track record in global Muslim-majority crisis zones.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations with a 100% compliance guarantee
Value high-capacity organizations that can respond to major emergencies like Gaza or Sudan
Prefer charities with the highest possible third-party transparency ratings
Seek to support a wide range of asnaf categories through a single gift
giving_considerations: Donations support a large-scale institutional machine rather than a small local project
High reserves mean the organization is stable but not in immediate financial peril
Impact is reported in aggregate numbers rather than individual beneficiary stories
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking small-scale, grassroots community projects or those who require rigorous RCT-level evidence for every dollar spent.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects strong outcome tracking (e.g., <cite id="6">420,204 people served in Palestine</cite>) but a lack of rigorous independent cost-effectiveness evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: IRUSA utilizes a <cite id="14">documented theory of change</cite> focused on moving communities from emergency relief to long-term self-reliance.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale humanitarian spending translates into measurable improvements in health and poverty levels.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite high revenue, the scale of global humanitarian crises in <cite id="4">Gaza, Sudan, and Yemen</cite> creates a continuous funding gap.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Global (US, Asia, Europe, Africa, South America)

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="3">perfect 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator score</cite> and deep roots in the Muslim community.

similar_organizations.differentiator: More focus on domestic US community services
similar_organizations.name: ICNA Relief

similar_organizations.differentiator: Specialized focus on nutrition and water
similar_organizations.name: Action Against Hunger USA

similar_organizations.differentiator: Broader focus on advocacy and policy change
similar_organizations.name: Oxfam America

strengths.detail: The organization holds a <cite id="3">perfect 100/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite> and has earned the <cite id="10">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>.
IRUSA maintains a high <cite id="7">program expense ratio of 80.3%</cite> and demonstrates excellent fundraising efficiency, spending only <cite id="11">$0.17 to raise every $1</cite>.

The charity successfully manages high-impact projects, such as <cite id="12">serving 100,000 people via Bahri Hospital</cite> and supporting over <cite id="5">15,000 displaced families in Sudan</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Islamic Relief USA's operational strength lies in its ability to combine religious compliance with professional institutional standards. Their <cite id="9">zakat policy is comprehensive</cite>, ensuring that 100% of designated funds reach eligible beneficiaries. This is backed by a massive financial engine that saw <cite id="2">revenue grow to over $165 million</cite> in 2023. Unlike many smaller peers, IRUSA maintains <cite id="8">18.0 months of operating reserves</cite>, providing a significant buffer against economic volatility or sudden humanitarian surges. Their governance is equally stable, featuring an <cite id="13">independent board</cite> and a <cite id="14">documented theory of change</cite> that guides their multi-sectoral interventions in health, food security, and emergency response.
rich_narrative.summary: Islamic Relief USA (IRUSA) is a premier humanitarian organization that has been <cite id="1">operating since 1994</cite> to alleviate poverty and provide emergency relief globally. The organization manages a massive scale of operations, reporting <cite id="2">$165,235,589 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. IRUSA is distinguished by its exceptional institutional health, maintaining a <cite id="3">perfect overall score of 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. Their programmatic reach is extensive, covering regions including <cite id="4">Sudan, Gaza, Pakistan, Yemen, and Lebanon</cite>. In conflict zones like Sudan, the organization has provided critical support to <cite id="5">15,268 forcibly displaced families</cite>, while their interventions in the Palestinian medical sector have <cite id="6">reached over 420,000 individuals</cite>. Financially, the charity operates with high efficiency, dedicating <cite id="7">80.3% of its total expenses to programs</cite> and maintaining <cite id="8">18.0 months of working capital</cite> to ensure long-term stability. For Muslim donors, IRUSA offers a robust <cite id="9">zakat-eligible platform</cite> that distributes funds across all eight asnaf categories, including the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin).
